glsa.title: MPlayer: Two heap overflow vulnerabilities
glsa.synopsis: Two vulnerabilities have been found in MPlayer which could lead to the remote execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: MPlayer is a media player capable of handling multiple multimedia file formats.

description.p: Heap overflows have been found in the code handling RealMedia RTSP and Microsoft Media Services streams over TCP (MMST).

impact.p: By setting up a malicious server and enticing a user to use its streaming data, a remote attacker could possibly execute arbitrary code on the client computer with the permissions of the user running MPlayer.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All MPlayer users should upgrade to the latest version:

references.uri: MPlayer News: Real RTSP heap overflow
